column4: BRIEF-Prologis Inc Files For Potential Mixed Shelf Offering, Size Not Disclosed
column6: * PROLOGIS INC FILES FOR POTENTIAL MIXED SHELF OFFERING; SIZE NOT DISCLOSED - SEC FILING Source text (bit.ly/2UwDpxr) Further company coverage:

column4: UPDATE 1-Norway wealth fund, Prologis in $2 bln real estate acquisition
column6: OSLO, Nov 25 (Reuters) - Norway’s sovereign wealth fund and property investment group Prologis Inc have agreed to jointly buy a $1.99 billion logistics real estate portfolio, Norges Bank Investment Management (NBIM) said in a statement.
column7: “The portfolio consists of 127 properties located across multiple U.S. markets, including Southern California, San Francisco Bay Area, Seattle and Dallas,” it added.
column8: NBIM, which manages the world’s largest sovereign wealth fund with assets of some $1.1 trillion, paid $896 million for a 45% stake in the portfolio, while Prologis will own the remaining 55% and manage the properties.
column9: The Norwegian fund invests in foreign bonds, stocks and real estate.
column10: In real estate, it concentrates on two types of investment: logistics centres near major cities which benefit from the growth in online shopping, and office buildings in the centre of major cities such as New York, Tokyo, London and Paris.
column11: The acquisition is part of Prologis Inc’s merger agreement to acquire Industrial Property Trust, Inc, NBIM added. (Reporting by Terje Solsvik, editing by Gwladys Fouche)

column4: Norway wealth fund, Prologis in $2 bln real estate acquisition
column5: OSLO, Nov 25 (Reuters) - Norway’s sovereign wealth fund and property investment group Prologis Inc. have agreed to jointly buy a $1.99 billion logistics real estate portfolio, Norges Bank Investment Management said in a statement.
column6: “The portfolio consists of 127 properties located across multiple U.S. markets, including Southern California, San Francisco Bay Area, Seattle and Dallas,” it added. (Reporting by Terje Solsvik, editing by Gwladys Fouche)

column4: Prologis to buy warehouse rival Liberty in $12.6 billion deal
column5: (Reuters) - Warehouse giant Prologis Inc PLD.N said on Sunday it had agreed to acquire rival industrial real-estate business Liberty Property Trust LPT.N in a $12.6 billion deal to improve its U.S. presence amid the ecommerce boom.
column6: If approved, Prologis said Liberty shareholders would receive 0.675 times a Prologis share for each unit they hold, about $61 a share. The deal is expected to close in the first quarter of 2020.
column7: Prologis, which has a global footprint, said the all-stock deal including the assumption of debt would deepen its presence in U.S. markets such as Pennsylvania’s Lehigh Valley, Chicago, Houston, New Jersey and Southern California.
column8: “Liberty’s logistics assets are highly complementary to our U.S. portfolio and this acquisition increases our holdings and growth potential in several key markets,” Prologis Chairman and Chief Executive Officer Hamid Moghadam said.
column9: “The joining of these two platforms at this moment, when industrial logistics has become so pivotal to the new economy, will further the industry’s ability to support the nation’s supply chain,” Liberty Chairman and Chief Executive Officer Bill Hankowsky said.
column10: Prologis plans to sell about $3.5 billion worth of assets, including $2.8 billion of “non-strategic” logistics properties and $700 million of office properties, the announcement said.
column11: The transaction is anticipated to immediately save around $120 million from administrative costs, operating leverage, lower interest expense and lease adjustments, the companies said.
column12: Activist investor Jonathan Litt of Land & Buildings Investment Management LLC had pushed Wayne, Pennsylvania-based Liberty to consider selling itself given what he considered to be undervalued shares and recent purchases of similar real-estate assets by Blackstone Group Inc BX.N and Prologis.
column13: Litt said in September he knew of an unnamed party willing to pay $60 a share for Liberty.
column14: Litt did not immediately respond to an email seeking comment Sunday night.
column15: Prologis customers, according to its website, include Amazon.com Inc AMZN.O , Walmart Inc WMT.N and FedEx Corp FDX.N.

column4: Prologis agrees to $12.6 bln all-stock deal to buy Liberty Property Trust
column5: Oct 27 (Reuters) - Logistics company Prologis Inc said on Sunday it had agreed to acquire commercial real estate firm Liberty Property Trust in an all-stock deal valued at about $12.6 billion, including debt, to improve its presence in some U.S. markets.
column6: For each Liberty share, its shareholders will receive 0.675 times of one Prologis share, Prologis said in a statement.
column7: Prologis, which has a global footprint, said the deal would deepen its presence in U.S. markets such as Pennsylvania’s Lehigh Valley, Chicago, Houston, New Jersey and Southern California. (Reporting by Ismail Shakil in Bengaluru; Editing by Peter Cooney)

column4: Prologis to buy IPT for about $4 billion
column5: (Reuters) - Prologis Inc PLD.N said on Monday it would buy Black Creek Group's Industrial Property Trust Inc (IPT) IDDP.PK, a portfolio of U.S. industrial properties, in an all-cash deal valued at about $4 billion.
column6: The company said the deal, which consists of 37.5 million square feet of industrial holdings with 236 properties, expands its footprint in Southern California, the San Francisco Bay area, Chicago, Atlanta, Dallas, Seattle and New Jersey.
column7: Prologis expects the deal to add to its annual core funds from operations by about 5 to 6.1 cents on a per share basis.
column8: The deal is expected to close around late this year or early next year.
column9: Morgan Stanley & Co LLC and Eastdil Secured LLC are the financial advisers to IPT while Hogan Lovells served as the legal adviser, real estate investment firm Black Creek, which created IPT in 2012, said in a separate statement.
column10: Prologis also reported a 14.7% rise in second quarter net income attributable to shareholders to $383.8 million. On a per share basis, it earned 60 cents in the quarter ended June 30 and raised its 2019 profit outlook to $2.38 to $2.46 per share from $2.08 to $2.18 per share.
column11: “We continue to see healthy market conditions, robust customer demand and rent growth that has exceeded our expectations,” said Prologis’ Chief Financial Officer Thomas Olinger.
column12: The company raised its annual forecast for its core funds from operations to be in the range of $3.26 to $3.30 per share from $3.20 to $3.26 per share. The forecast does not include the impact of the proposed deal.

column4: Prologis to buy IPT for $3.99 bln
column5: July 15 (Reuters) - Prologis Inc said on Monday it would buy Black Creek Group’s Industrial Property Trust Inc (IPT), a portfolio of U.S. industrial properties, in a deal valued at $3.99 billion in cash.
column6: The deal is expected to close around late this year or early next year.

column4: Norway wealth fund bought stakes in U.S. logistics properties
column5: OSLO (Reuters) - Norway’s sovereign wealth fund, the world’s biggest, has bought six logistics properties in Chicago, Nashville and Orlando together with real estate partner Prologis, the fund said on Wednesday.
column6: “Norges Bank Real Estate Management paid $87.7 million for its 45 percent interest ... The sellers are ventures between Prologis and U.S. pension funds managed by J.P. Morgan Asset Management,” it added.
column7: The properties have a total area of 2.8 million square feet.

column4: Norway's sovereign wealth sells logistic properties for $287 mln
column5: OSLO, Oct 2 (Reuters) - Norway’s sovereign wealth fund sold 37 logistics properties that it co-owned with Prologis, situated in the United States, France, Poland, Hungary and the Netherlands, the fund said on Tuesday.
column6: The fund received $182.6 million for its 45-percent ownership interest in the U.S. portfolio and 90.2 million euro ($104.06 million) for its 50-percent ownership in the European portfolio, it added in a statement.
column7: The properties were acquired as part of larger portfolio transactions spanning from March 2013 to May 2015. The buyer of the portfolio is Mapletree, a real estate firm with headquarters in Singapore.

column4: Norway wealth fund buys logistics real estate in California
column5: OSLO (Reuters) - Norway’s sovereign wealth fund, the world’s largest, has bought a logistics property in the U.S. state of California with its property partner Prologis, it said on Thursday.
column6: The fund paid $25.4 million for a 45-percent stake in the property. Prologis will hold the remaining 55 percent. The seller was Barings.
column7: The two companies have also sold a logistics property in Dallas, Texas, to Kohler for which the fund will receive $31 million, it added.

column4: Logistics leader Prologis to acquire DCT Industrial for $8.4 billion
column5: NEW YORK (Reuters) - Prologis Inc PLD.NPLD.N, a logistics company with a global footprint, will acquire smaller U.S. rival DCT Industrial Trust Inc DCT.N in an $8.4 billion all-stock transaction, including the assumption of debt, the two companies said on Sunday.
column6: The acquisition will deepen Prologis’ presence in high-growth markets including Southern California, the San Francisco Bay Area, New York, New Jersey, Seattle and South Florida, the companies said in a statement.
column7: DCT shareholders will receive 1.02 Prologis shares for every DCT share they own. The transaction is expected to close in the third quarter and is subject to the approval of DCT stockholders, among other customary conditions, they said.
column8: The board of directors of both companies unanimously approved the transaction, which is expected to create near-term savings of about $80 million, the statement said.
column9: The deal is the largest for Prologis since it merged with AMB Property Corp in 2011 in an $8.7 billion transaction.
column10: Prologis owned or managed more than 3,200 properties worldwide as of Dec. 31 and leased facilities to about 5,000 customers, the largest being Amazon.com followed by DHL. Seventy percent of its business is U.S. based.

column4: Logistics leader Prologis to acquire DCT Industrial for $8.4 bln
column5: NEW YORK, April 29 (Reuters) - Prologis Inc , a logistics company with a global footprint, will acquire smaller U.S. rival DCT Industrial Trust Inc in an $8.4 billion all-stock transaction, including the assumption of debt, the two companies said on Sunday.
column6: The acquisition will deepen Prologis’ presence in high-growth markets including Southern California, the San Francisco Bay Area, New York and New Jersey, Seattle and South Florida, the companies said in a statement.
column7: The board of directors of both companies unanimously approved the transaction, they said.

column4: Norway's sovereign fund and Prologis sell logistics properties
column5: OSLO, April 26 (Reuters) - Norway’s $1 trillion sovereign wealth fund and its real estate partner Prologis have sold eight logistics properties in France, the Netherlands and Spain to Ares Management, the fund said on Thursday.
column6: “Norges Bank Real Estate Management received 40.5 million euros ($49.35 million) for its 50 percent ownership interest. The properties were acquired in March 2013, as part of a larger portfolio across Europe,” it added.
